comments.body: I saw the artwork, I love it. This should DEFINITELY be in the game!

i like but if it cant spawn naturally it seems like it needs a better drop other wise it could seem like a waste of copper to me but if this somehow became another way to farm copper im totally on bored
It's not really a way to farm copper, you summon the Copper Golem to help defend against mobs and if it dies, it'll drop a small amount of copper that could help the player fund a new one.
I love this better than the other 2 it’s a ranged golem this could be used for a witch farm or a pilin farm sorry for spelling but this makes copper 10 times more useful
The sad / funny thing is we could see a Copper Golem in Minecraft, just not this one. They revealed the Copper Golem as one of the vote options.
I want hiiiiim
PLZ MINECRAFT ADD THE COPPER GOLEM
Yeah, I would love glowing ink.
I really hope they do this. It would also make people less salty about the glow squids winning.

Glow Ink could be used on other things besides armor such as wool and other dyable blocks and items. At the very least, I think it should give the block/item a glowing texture, but it could also emit some light, although I would make it very low.
You should be able to dye it again and then you could have different coloured lights

Please let us have glow dye to dye ANYTHING that can be dyed. And allow glow dye to be combined with other dyes. My child wants a blow in pink sheep! A glowing bed... Glow cement... The possibilities are so much fun...

Please let us have glow dye to dye ANYTHING that can be dyed. And allow glow dye to be combined with other dyes. My child wants a glowing pink sheep! A glowing bed... Glow cement... The possibilities are so much fun...
Yea, but the armour couldn’t emit light because it’s on an entity so it would just work like the glow squid - you can see it in the dark but it doesn’t light surroundings

I think it should stay entity based to go along with what Minecraft already has set up, but having glowing armor would be a very good way to coordinate with each other in underground or otherwise dark environments.
Imagine a group of friends exploring a cave. Of course, they use torches to light the area up but being able to see each other in the dark by using the weakest armor in the game adds an extra layer of depth to how players can interact with each other.
And make it so it can be put on Pets, like the cat's and dog's collars, or horse armor, to make it easier to find your pets in the dark.
I know this is necroposting but WE HAVE TO GET THE GLOWING DYES
I was just about to make a post about this lmfao. I would also love for these to be more hostile to the player but they wouldn't make them like that cause they're endangered probably.
They are adding a dark brown one if you look close at the trailer also they have reavled a lime and purple one too!

Yes! Could we please have black/melanoid axolotls? It wouldn’t make to add these endangered creatures if they weren’t also going to add black axolotls, a common type of axolotl. Minecraft has shown artwork of brown/wild, pink/leucistic, gold and even purple axolotls so I don’t think it’d hurt to add black ones too.

I was going to make a post like this and would recommend they added copper and melanoid (black) axolotls with blue gills, not to mention dirty (or speckled) variants kind of like how horses have pattern options
I live this idea
Instead of an octopus how about a squid. A kraken
Kraken, Leviathan, and tamatoa (from Moana movie). That would be awesome and dangerous at the same time

I like the idea of a sea monster. Right now traveling the ocean is a little too safe. The only problems seem to be an arrow or trident breaking your boat, or it being broken by a magma cube column. This would add something slightly terrifying to rowing over the ocean.
I think it should shoot spectral arrows instead of arrows of teleportation.
I think they should shoot arrows of weakness, or poison. teleportation arrows could be a concept for the end dimension. Other than that I like the idea!
what if the arrows are called warped arrows and this can't happen to wither skeletons because they're already adapted to the nether
That's exactly what I thought. On one hand it'd be way faster to get to the end but on the other hand I saw way too many and not a single zombie pigman.
They should replace them with some equally strong mob instead.

I agree. It's incredibly easy to get ender pearls now to get to The End. Also, warped forests seem to be the most common nether biome now, making Endermen likely the most common mob in the Nether, which makes it kinda boring and too similar to The End.

I don't think Endermen should even spawn any more commonly in the Nether than they do in the overworld. The warped forests should instead have a different mob, maybe Zombie Pigmen or a new mob. Zombie Pigmen being the primary mob of warped forests could also explain why there are no piglins or hoglins there (since they're scared of them, I think).

This is a major issue regarding natural game progression and should get more upvotes and attention. Endermen are supposed to be rare so that the end would be harder to each. However, the warped forest is making this process way easier not only because of the increased spawnrate, but also because of the environment. Netherack is way to easy to break compared to stone and end stone, and endermen can't even pick them up. Not only that, there are not terrain destroying mobs like ghasts and creepers in this biome, no 1 or 2 block tall mobs that can reach wherever you can go, and no ranged mobs that can shoot you through tiny holes. All you have to do now is just quickly dig a hole on the wall for less than a second and scan across the forest to lure in the mobs that can't even fit in your hole. This is a major change in speedrunning strategies and should therefore, be changed. Maybe endermites would be the better alternative. Magma cubes could also be a good replacement since they don't have a designated spawn area yet.

I just think that if they not only have their own dimension, why have so many in the nether? Not only that but they actively destroy the biome so quickly. Like, whats the point of adding a new biome if the mobs that spawn in it just destroy it over time?

It’s al little op to have endermen in the nether

It’ll make it really quick to make the portal

Yeah, if you want a mob for the wrapped forest just bring back zombie pigman  or make a new mod b like an enderman but with blueish-greenish  eyes (  like the wrapped forest) and their name doesn't have anything to do with the end  and they don't open their mouth like endermen and they drop a "wrapped pearls " or something and they don't take damage from water.

Yeah, and replace them with "wrapped slendermen" or something that doesn't have anything to do with the end.And their eyes will turn red when hostile   instead  of  opening their mouth.Also they build bridges across lava and that is the only way they pick up blocks. They will be hostile to endermen.

Because endermen are a disgrace to the nether. (I just call them trespassers).
I like it This means I can finally beat Minecraft under 3h 20m in real life
Me enfadan mucho los endermans
I think the chance should be a bit lower IMO
I think the opportunity to get an iron pick from a zombie would be helpful for new players in early game if their pickaxe breaks
Rather than dropping the flowers dye, why not drop the flower itself?
RedstoneNoM1X they don't drop the dyes, they can be milked for dyes. But if killed then yes, they should drop a flower or two.

Good, but perhaps like how you can milk a Mooshroom for Mushroom Stew, maybe milking a Moobloom should give you Suspicious Stew.

Also, like the Mooshroom, shearing a Moobloom should turn it into a regular cow and drop 2-4 random flowers (Excluding Wither Rose, and all tall flowers).

Maybe the Moobloom should have a 0.2% chance to spawn instead of a normal cow, but maybe flower fields have a 1/3 chance of generating with a Moobloom already spawned.

Upon death, Mooblooms drop their beef and leather, but should also drop 1-3 random dyes as well.
This should be renamed to Zombie Villager Variants.
I agree with you Kani.
i like this ide, but they should be cureable
They would be curable, you would just have to moisten or dry them first by bringing the to a desert or ocean

how about this for curing the villager. if it a drowned villager, you will need to first put a water breathing potion, then weakness potion, then golden apple is given the the drowned villager. If it is a husk villager, then instead of a water breathing potion, it would be fire resistance.
I would have Drowned Villagers have a Sea Pickle for a nose

Yeah it's weird to see that human zombies have multiple variants, while zombie villagers have only one type (not counting babies) also i do like the sea pickle nose for drowned villagers, it would be as if they are a nose amputee or something and it fits the aquatic theme

Attacking spiders is a great idea for bats! Also, I really want to see bats spawn and fly up in the skies! But it doesn't really occur to me why they should spawn near lava pools. Maybe having them avoiding heat, fire and lava would make more sense. Also, it would probably be useful the same way, like "Oof, there is a bat down there, so there is no lava around!"
Maybe near underground water
I like the idea but as Henrik said Bats avoid lava and light, so maybe the sight of a Bat should mean there is no lava around.

i think focusing more on bats is a wonderful idea! your suggestions made me think of something; bats leading you to a mineshaft by giving them berries (i think bats eat some berries?). it'd make sense as they spend the most time in caves, and theyd still be able to avoid light, like they do in the current gameplay.

First of all, I love the idea. Second, I believe bats could be used for even more mechanics;
Bats should appear more at night, hunting for food. This could come in handy, if a player is attacked by a spider the bats will save him.
And bats are, like bees, pollinators. Which means that the could come to your crops and make them grow faster.
Did you know that bats also eat bees? I’d love to see a bat attacking a hive at night. He will only kill one bee, but he’ll also stop by and pollinate the area.
At last, I’d love to have a mob that takes a grown crop and replants it, while leaving you the food it grown. I think it would be a cool mechanic to add to bats and update them as mobs.
Or maybe they can be killed for tools or armor like bat fang armor or bat fanged tools
I’m a similar note, bats could do something depending on light level. For example, have bats sleep at any light level above 4, and fly at any light level lower than that.

I like the sea turtles as passive mobs.

Snapping turtles will literally bite anything that gets close enough with the intent of eating it, but that's not a reason for sea turtles in Minecraft to be aggressive mobs.
They should be as neutral as polar bears.  If something attracts a baby, many adults get mad.  If something attacks an adult, a few adults get mad.
I personally love this idea. The golden toad story is tragic, and I think Minecraft should have a say in it.
plz mojang and make it drop something like a golden ingot or something plz plz love u mojang
that will be fantastic ✨✨✨
It should drop a Gold block or Just a gold ingot

As a toad lover I totally agree but I made a post called Toads! and this fits perfectly in with it. I bread toads to release in to the wild to prevent similar problems from happening again, and I’ve decided to at least try to clone this and other extinct toads. I hope they add this to honor incilius peiglenes and other extinct toads and to help prevent this from happening again. If you want one of us can merge the ideas.
Yes! I want it however long it takes!
Please if you truly care about the community add the copper golem.
It was nearly 50/50, people clearly want it
Pls pls pls they are so cute and I have so many ideas for them!

They should light our minecraft world...
So please add them ...they are the true purpose of copper.
It was almost a 50/50 vote. Please consider the idea of adding them would be a lot of fun.
I prefer the Furnace Golem , add both golems c:
The the copper golem is a good use for copper, and right now the only use for copper is building.
Yeah. They said they would add it if it adds playability in the future, and it still does.
Or or maybe glow paint to make any block glow?
The squid could drop an item that you can use to make armor glow in caves or during night time. Or make new types of light sources
The cuteness scale on this would be through the roof. Instead of a bow and arrow, it should throw snowballs and eggs xD
no
Thanks for your opinions guys
Maybe it could also have a crossbow instead of a normal bow?
Needs to be for all variants too, skeletons, strays and wither skeletons.
Maybe for certain self-defense it could easily pull out a wooden sword to try and attack you at close range.
They have been adding new variants so it would only make sense.
They have been adding new variants so it would only make sense.
Better aim, faster firing...  What's not to love?

This Is a great Idea,

It could easily be done that a animal is coded to have a certain personality number, say number 3 is playfull, and rarely the animal would play a small animation based on its personality, adding a level of uniqueness to otherwise bland animals.

This could lead to having a favourite wolf that runs around the player occasionally, or a sleepy old horse thats always laying down, even as far as a fish in your aquarium that shoots around faster then the others.
It would be very overpowered for those items to be able to completely automatically farm
Maybe you should be able to put in multiple emeralds and the average reward level increases with each one? Because emeralds are pretty easy to get if you have found a village.

I think that regal tigers should be adjusted to be more like the ones in Minecraft Legends, so I suggest the following changes:

  • They are found in savannas, not jungles or glaciers.
  • They only attack when they're untamed.
  • They don't drop their teeth when they die.
This is a great idea. Making it so that you need a totem is perfect because it’s a late game item and the phoenix seems like a late game companion.
You should add a downside to them

I agree its frustrating when you go to hide from Polar Bears in a house they can still hit you if you are beside the wall or if you are a good ways away from the cub the Mama Bear still gets angry with you
i like this idea, also i think they should add orangutans to minecraft
I agree with u
Yes good idea (:

This is the user who made this post, I have more variants I just ran out of characters.

16:Frozen Wolf, spawns in the ice spikes biome, white with icy blue paws/faces/tails.

17:Kelp Wolf, spawns in the kelp forest biome thang, dark green with kelp-like stripes.

18:Dark Wolf, spawns in the dark forest, brownish black with tan underbellies/pawn/snouts.

19:Cloudy Wolf, spawns in extreme hills, white and poofy-looking

20:Spikey Wolf, dripstone colored with that pattern on dripstone blocks.
